channel.title: Major computer laggggg
channel.description:
my computer is a 1 yr old dell dimension e310, i am currently having huge lagging problems with it, not much is working and when it does it takes 4ever 2 load nething. it has been freezing a lot lately, is there something i can do 2 make it go fast again. it was fine a little while ago. i have 1gb of ram and 160 gb hd
plz help me

item.title: Major computer laggggg
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:13, topic:101299”][quote author=Gotta Catch Them All link=topic=145299.msg1392023#msg1392023 date=1180405832]

Perhaps “messing” was not the right word…I changed some settings in the BIOS wich made my computer stop lagging.
That sounds better doesnt it?

If you knew what you were doing yes… Don’t tell someone who you don’t know to mess with their BIOS, for all you know they could be the noobiest noob from MoparScape.
[/quote]

The noobiest noob woulnt know how to get to their BIOS.[/quote]

And it would be a good thing they wrecked their computer. But oh well.

Read full topic

item.title: Major computer laggggg
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

lol just had to throw in my $.02 here, yea i dont think you wanna just ‘mess’ with your bios, thats a real good way to fick up something…

Read full topic

item.title: Major computer laggggg
item.dc:creator: @bsballastro bsballastro
item.description:
@bsballastro wrote:

ok i fixed it, there were many procces that were useless that i ended-deleted random programs (garbage)
and thats it thanks guys

and Tribal never ever mess with ur bios, it will make things worse

Read full topic

item.title: Major computer laggggg
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

Rofl, no you really aren’t because you are talking about “messing” around with the Bios, which is a nono.

You might be right in the fact that adjusting something in the Bios might solve his problem, but simply “messing” around with them is wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Major computer laggggg
item.dc:creator: @Tribal Tribal
item.description:
@Tribal wrote:

[quote=“Bebemycat2, post:6, topic:101299”][quote author=Tribal link=topic=145299.msg1386681#msg1386681 date=1180324392]

I’ve had this problem too, my processes were fine but there is something wrong with your BIOS.
I’ve solved this problem by just messing with my BIOS

I wouldn’t recommend “messing” with your BIOS.

i reformatted and still my computer was lagging like hell , so i guess messing with my BIOS wouldnt hurt…and i was right
[/quote]
No you should never “mess” with your BIOS unless you know what you are doing.

So you were wrong.[/quote]
But my computer stopped lagging, so i was RIGHT!!

Read full topic

So you were wrong.

item.title: Major computer laggggg
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

Try reformatting.
Also, try to delete some of the processes consuming programs and try and got with more lightweight alternatives.

What is your firewall?
What are some of the common programs you run?

You may also have spyware or a virus as there can effect system performance.

Read full topic
